title: About Mathew Frame
text:
Mathew is a fourth-year finance student at the University of Alberta with a proven track record of exceeding expectations both personally and professionally. In his role at SGI, he found a way to automate over 100 annual hours spent on reporting data. Within 2 months Mathew was tasked with leading and training his team of 9 employees through a major software transition. In his first two weeks at CNRL, Mathew learned how to read engineering drawings from all disciplines and completed analysis of a project worth over $5 million. By the end of his work term, he was collaborating with engineers to sharpen estimates on a project worth over $50 million.
In his final two years of studies, Mathew has focused his learning on data science, programming, machine learning, and risk management. This was all accomplished while working as an insurance underwriting analyst, teaching assistant, and finance tutor.
Mathew is seeking opportunities to grow his skillset and work on impactful teams in the oil and gas sector.
